alert.note: Alert for Ottawa (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 4:13PM EDT until further notice by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. .Heavy rainfall across the Grand River basin this morning has pushed expected flooding conditions to more severe levels. The upcoming flood levels should be similar to what was experienced in May of 2020 along the Grand River. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River at Robinson Township. * WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Vanlopik Road is 2 to 3 feet under water. Moderate flooding of several homes on the east end of Vanlopik subdivision occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 15.9 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 13.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.8 feet on 05/23/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
